thread.title: Turkish Airlines Sponsoring Super Bowl Pregame Show Raises Questions On Social Media
thread.title_full: Turkish Airlines Sponsoring Super Bowl Pregame Show Raises Questions On Social Media

author: Shawn Rice
title: Turkish Airlines Sponsoring Super Bowl Pregame Show Raises Questions On Social Media
text:
Turkish Airlines is a sponsor for the pregame show for the Super Bowl. In this current political climate, this sponsor raised some questions on social media. As President Donald Trump issued an executive order banning immigrants from certain Middle Eastern countries, social media users took notice of the advertising from Turkish Airlines. 
Turkish Airlines is the national flag carrier airline of Turkey. As of July 2015, it operates scheduled services to 290 destinations in Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas, making it the fourth-largest carrier in the world by number of destinations, as of 2014. It serves more destinations non-stop from a single airport than any other airline in Europe. Turkish Airlines flies to 115 countries, more than any other airline. 
With an operational fleet of ten cargo aircraft, the airline’s cargo division serves 52 destinations. Istanbul Atatürk Airport is its main base, and there are secondary hubs at Esenboğa International Airport, Sabiha Gökçen International Airport, and Adnan Menderes Airport. Turkish Airlines has been a member of the Star Alliance network since 1 April 2008.
Here are some reactions to people discussing Turkish Airlines’ Super Bowl sponsorship.
Why is the Super Bowl pre game on Fox sponsored by Turkish airlines? We do know that Turkey is run by a dictator right?
— StillWaters (@Keerg74) February 5, 2017 

An American Super Bowl sponsored by Turkish Airlines? #WTF 
— Bob Kevoian (@bobkevoian) February 5, 2017 

What is with "Turkish Airlines" sponsoring the FOX SPORTS Pre Game desk?? Where is American or Delta or Jet Blue or Southwest airlinesETC?
— Quack (@Docterduck) February 5, 2017 

#SuperBowlsponsored by # Turkish Airlines? Turkey must not be on the ban list
— Albert J Castro (@albert1969) February 5, 2017 

I love NFL but why in the hell is Turkish Airlines a damn sponser of the NFL?!? @realDonaldTrump pic.twitter.com/FFP3EQR5EK 
— TRUMPQUILITY (@trumpquility1) February 5, 2017 

LOL at conservatives upset at TURKISH AIRLINES sponsoring the FOX #SuperBowl lounge. You guys are so predictably racist.
— Tim Doyle (@NakatomiTim) February 5, 2017 

Fox couldn't find an American sponsor? They had to go with Turkish Airlines? Biggest American event and they have Turkish fucking airlines?
— MD (@Manny_25__) February 5, 2017 

HolyCrap! Did fox just advertise Turkish Airlines? Now we know where all the so called terror is coming from. Maybe we can blame them
— MotorcycleBum (@Motorcyclebum) February 5, 2017 

Spend all you want on ads hell you can even take those crying liberals but you'll NEVER be in validated in #TrumpsAmerica "Turkish Airlines"
— #TrumpWins4USA (@PutinsHacker) February 5, 2017 

What did you think of the sponsorship by Turkish Airlines? Sound off below in the comments section.
